roleset.name: (cause to) become slightly wet
roleset.note: DAMPEN-V NOTES: Based on wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet. Member of VNcls other_cos-45.4. (from dampen.01-v)

roles.note: arg0 not grammatical, most likely (from damp.02-j)

example.name: dampen-v: all args
example.text: John dampened Mary's silk blouse with red wine.

roleset.name: (cause to) stop vibrating, restrain, lessen
roleset.note: DAMPENED-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to dampen.02. Dampen.02 is a member of Vn class subjugate-42.3. Framed by Katie. (from dampened.01-j)

example.name: dampen-v: just transitive
example.text: An accelerating move by personal computer manufacturers' to include advanced graphics capabilities as standard equipment further dampened reseller purchases of Western Digital's equipment.
example.arg: An accelerating move by personal computer manufacturers' to include advanced graphics capabilities as standard equipment
reseller purchases of Western Digital's equipment

example.name: dampen-v: arg 1
example.text: In addition, below the distal anastomsis flow in the native anterior tibial artery is markedly dampened.
example.arg: flow in the native anterior tibial artery

roleset.name: be slightly wet
roleset.note: DAMP-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6, dampen-v.01. Not related to damp-v.01. (from damp.02-j)

example.name: damp-j: args 1, 2
example.text: At the peak of my smoking addiction , I would smoke even the worst cigarettes that-1 [*-1] were damp from lubricants , and would sometimes smoke so much that I got giddy ,

roleset.name: to restrain or weaken
roleset.note: DAMP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'damp' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from damp.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: damp-v: transitive
example.text: [Comments by John Major , who [*T*-1] has succeeded Mr. Lawson ,]-2 also failed [*-2] to damp market concern , despite his pledge [*] to maintain relatively high British interest rates .

example.name: damp-v: transitive with purpose
example.text: But in certain conditions such as autoimmune diseases and allergies and transplant rejection , doctors-1 would like [*-1] to damp the immune response so such cells do n't touch off harmful inflammatory reactions or cell destruction .
example.arg: so such cells do n't touch off harmful inflammatory reactions or cell destruction
